009package Ch10_Line_Fitting;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.ImagesToStack;
013import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
014import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line.LineFit;
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line.LinearRegressionFit;
019import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line.OrthogonalLineFitEigen;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line.utils.LineSampler;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.AffineMapping2D;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.Rotation2D;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.Translation2D;
025import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
026import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
027
028import java.awt.Color;
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.List;
031
032/**
033 * <p>
034 * ImageJ demo plugin, performs line fitting to a randomly sampled point set
035 * that is rotated in uniform steps. The result is shown as a stack of images
036 * with graphic overlays.
037 * </p>
038 * <p>
039 * Two fitting methods are employed: (a) linear regression fitting, (b)
040 * orthogonal regression fitting. The result of the first varies with rotation,
041 * while orthogonal fitting is rotation-invariant. See Sec. 10.2 (Fig. 10.4) of
042 * [1] for additional details.
043 * </p>
044 * <p>
045 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
046 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
047 * </p>
048 * 
049 * @author WB
050 * @version 2022/09/30
051 * @see imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line.LinearRegressionFit
052 * @see imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line.OrthogonalLineFitEigen
053 */
054public class Line_Rotation_Demo implements PlugIn {
055
056        public static int W = 400;
057        public static int H = 400;
058        
059        public static final double StrokeWidth = 1.0;
060        public static double DashLength = 10;
061        
062        public static final Color CentroidColor =               new Color(0,176,80);
063        public static final Color RegressionFitColor =  new Color(255,0,0);
064        public static final Color OrthogonalFitColor =  new Color(0,112,192);
065        public static final Color PointColor = Color.blue;
066        public static double PointRadius = 2;
067
068        public static Pnt2d P1 = Pnt2d.from(50, 0.5*H);
069        public static Pnt2d P2 = Pnt2d.from(W-50, 0.5*H);
070        public static int N = 100;
071        public static double Sigma = 15.0;
072
073        public static boolean DrawSamplePoints = true;
074        public static boolean DrawOrthogalFit = true;
075        public static boolean DrawRegressionFit = true;
076        public static boolean DrawCentroid = true;
077
078        @Override
079        public void run(String arg) {
080                Pnt2d[] pts0 = new LineSampler(P1, P2).getPoints(N, Sigma);     
081                Translation2D t1 = new Translation2D(-0.5 * W, -0.5 * H);
082                Translation2D t2 = t1.getInverse();
083                
084                List<ImagePlus> imageList = new ArrayList<>();
085                
086                ColoredStroke pointStroke = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, PointColor, 0);
087                pointStroke.setFillColor(PointColor);
088                ColoredStroke strokeOrth = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, OrthogonalFitColor, 0);
089                ColoredStroke strokeReg = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, RegressionFitColor, DashLength);
090                ColoredStroke strokeCtr = new ColoredStroke(StrokeWidth, CentroidColor, 0);
091
092                // step-wise rotation about the image center (in degrees):
093                for (int theta = 0; theta < 120; theta += 20) {         
094                        Rotation2D rot = new Rotation2D(Math.toRadians(theta));
095                        AffineMapping2D map = t1.concat(rot).concat(t2);
096                        Pnt2d[] pts = map.applyTo(pts0);
097
098                        LineFit fitOrth = new OrthogonalLineFitEigen(pts);
099                        AlgebraicLine lineOrth = fitOrth.getLine();
100
101                        LineFit fitReg = new LinearRegressionFit(pts);
102                        AlgebraicLine lineReg = fitReg.getLine();
103
104                        ByteProcessor ip = new ByteProcessor(W, H);
105                        ip.setColor(255);
106                        ip.fill();
107
108                        ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter();
109
110                        if (DrawSamplePoints) {                         
111                                for (Pnt2d p : pts) {
112                                        ola.addShape(p.getShape(PointRadius), pointStroke);
113                                }
114                        }
115
116                        if (DrawOrthogalFit) {
117                                ola.addShape(lineOrth.getShape(W, H), strokeOrth);
118                        }
119
120                        if (DrawRegressionFit) {
121                                ola.addShape(lineReg.getShape(W, H), strokeReg);
122                        }
123                        
124                        if (DrawCentroid) {
125                                Pnt2d ctr = PntUtils.centroid(pts);                     
126                                ola.addShape(ctr.getShape(PointRadius*2), strokeCtr);
127                        }
128
129                        String title = String.format("line-%03d", theta);
130                        ImagePlus im = new ImagePlus(title, ip);
131                        im.setOverlay(ola.getOverlay());
132                        imageList.add(im);
133                }
134                
135                ImagePlus stackIm = ImagesToStack.run(imageList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]));
136                stackIm.setTitle(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
137                stackIm.show();
138        }
139
140}
